info.description:
armstrong.apps.series
=====================
Provides way to create series of content


Usage
-----
**TODO**


Installation & Configuration
----------------------------
You can install the latest release of ``armstrong.apps.series`` using `pip`_:

::

    pip install armstrong.apps.series

Make sure to add ``armstrong.apps.series``to your ``INSTALLED_APPS``.  You can
add this however you like.  This works as a copy-and-paste solution:

::

	INSTALLED_APPS += ["armstrong.apps.series", ]

Once installed, you have to run either ``syncdb``, or ``migrate`` if you are
using `South`_.

.. _pip: http://www.pip-installer.org/
.. _South: http://south.aeracode.org/


Contributing
------------

* Create something awesome -- make the code better, add some functionality,
  whatever (this is the hardest part).
* `Fork it`_
* Create a topic branch to house your changes
* Get all of your commits in the new topic branch
* Submit a `pull request`_

.. _pull request: http://help.github.com/pull-requests/
.. _Fork it: http://help.github.com/forking/


State of Project
----------------
Armstrong is an open-source news platform that is freely available to any
organization.  It is the result of a collaboration between the `Texas Tribune`_
and `Bay Citizen`_, and a grant from the `John S. and James L. Knight
Foundation`_.

To follow development, be sure to join the `Google Group`_.

``armstrong.apps.articles`` is part of the `Armstrong`_ project.  You're
probably looking for that.

.. _Texas Tribune: http://www.texastribune.org/
.. _Bay Citizen: http://www.baycitizen.org/
.. _John S. and James L. Knight Foundation: http://www.knightfoundation.org/
.. _Google Group: http://groups.google.com/group/armstrongcms
.. _Armstrong: http://www.armstrongcms.org/
